TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract Row

Docs.summary: Represents a row in a table.

remarks.para: The Row object is a member of the collection. The Rows collection includes all the rows in the specified selection, range, or table.
Use Rows(), where is the index number, to return a single Row object. The index number represents the position of the row in the selection, range, or table.
Use the method to add a row to a table.
Use the property to modify the individual cells in a Row object.

remarks.para: WdRowAlignment can be one of the following constants:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int AllowBreakAcrossPages { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.AllowBreakAcrossPages : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if the text in a table row or rows are allowed to split across a page break.

remarks.para: The property return values can be True, False or wdUndefined (only some of the specified text is allowed to split).

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToText (ref object Separator, ref object NestedTables);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range ConvertToText([in]object& Separator, [in]object& NestedTables) runtime managed
Public Function ConvertToText (Optional ByRef Separator As Object, Optional ByRef NestedTables As Object) As Range
abstract member ConvertToText : obj * obj -> Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range

Docs.param: Optional Object. The character that delimits the converted columns (paragraph marks delimit the converted rows). Can be any following constants:wdSeparateByCommaswdSeparateByDefaultListSeparatorwdSeparateByParagraphswdSeparateByTabs Default
Optional Object. True if nested tables are converted to text. This argument is ignored if is not wdSeparateByParagraphs. The default value is True.
Docs.summary: Converts a table to text and returns a object that represents the delimited text.

remarks.para: When you apply the ConvertToText method to a object, the object is deleted. To maintain a reference to the converted contents of the table, you must assign the Range object returned by the ConvertToText method to a new object variable.

Public Function ConvertToTextOld (Optional ByRef Separator As Object) As Range

Docs.summary: Reserved for internal use.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the specified object was created.

remarks.para: If the specified object was created in Microsoft Word, this property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This value can also be represented by the constant wdCreatorCode.

The Creator property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int HeadingFormat { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.HeadingFormat : int with get, set

Docs.summary: Determines if the specified row or rows are formatted as a table heading.

remarks.para: Rows formatted as table headings are repeated when a table spans more than one page.
Possible property values can be True, False or wdUndefined.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property float Height { float get(); void set(float value); };
member this.Height : single with get, set

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the height of the specified row in a table.

remarks.para: If the property of the specified row is wdRowHeightAuto, Height returns wdUndefined. Setting the Height property sets HeightRule to wdRowHeightAtLeast.

remarks.para: can be one of the following constants:

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the identifying label for the specified object when the current document is saved as a Web page.

remarks.para: With the exception of the object, you can use a label as a hyperlink reference from other Web pages or from within the current document.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property NestingLevel As Integer
public: property int NestingLevel { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the nesting level of the specified row.

remarks.para: The outermost table has a nesting level of 1. The nesting level of each successively nested table is one higher than the previous table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetHeight([in]float32 RowHeight, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdRowHeightRule HeightRule) runtime managed
Public Sub SetHeight (RowHeight As Single, HeightRule As WdRowHeightRule)

Docs.param: Required Single. The height of the row or rows, in points.
Required . The rule for determining the height of the specified rows.WdRowHeightRule can be one of the following constants:wdRowHeightAtLeastwdRowHeightExactlywdRowHeightAuto
Docs.summary: Sets the height of table rows.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetLeftIndent([in]float32 LeftIndent, [in]valuetype Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.WdRulerStyle RulerStyle) runtime managed
Public Sub SetLeftIndent (LeftIndent As Single, RulerStyle As WdRulerStyle)

Docs.param: Required Single. The distance (in points) between the current left edge of the specified row or rows and the desired left edge.

Required . Controls the way Microsoft Word adjusts the table when the left indent is changed.WdRulerStyle can be one of the following constants: wdAdjustNone – Adjusts the left edge of row or rows, preserving the width of all columns by shifting them to the left or right. This is the default value. wdAdjustSameWidth – Adjusts the left edge of the first column, preserving the position of the right edge of the table by setting the widths of all the cells in the specified row or rows to the same value. wdAdjustFirstColumn – Adjusts the left edge of the first column only, preserving the positions of the other columns and the right edge of the table. wdAdjustProportional – Adjusts the left edge of the first column, preserving the position of the right edge of the table by proportionally adjusting the widths of all the cells in the specified row or rows.
Docs.summary: Sets the indentation for a row or rows in a table.

remarks.para: The WdRulerStyle behavior described above applies to left-aligned tables. The WdRulerStyle behavior for center- and right-aligned tables can be unexpected; in these cases, the SetLeftIndent method should be used with care.
